paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2-K897T polymorphism and its interaction with LQT2-causing mutations A561T and N996I, focusing on their effects on electrophysiological properties and penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Experiences arrhythmias and prolonged QT interval.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The KCNH2-K897T polymorphism was present in the affected individual.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with LQT2, presenting with syncope.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The KCNH2-K897T polymorphism was present in the affected individual.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms reported despite carrying the variant.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The KCNH2-K897T polymorphism was present in the unaffected individual.
The KCNH2-K897T polymorphism was present in the unaffected individual.

functional_data.summary: The KCNH2-K897T polymorphism influences the biophysical properties of the hERG channel, particularly in its interaction with LQT2 mutations.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2-K897T polymorphism segregates with disease in some families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the complex interaction between common polymorphisms and rare mutations in influencing disease phenotype.
key_quotes: The common polymorphism KCNH2-K897T differs in its influence on LQT2-causing KCNH2 mutations depending on whether it is present in cis or trans.
The KCNH2-K897T polymorphism was present in the affected individual.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
